children.name: red blood cell
children.definition: / red corpuscle  any of the cells that carry oxygen around the body : hồng cầu
examples: erythrocyte[ C ] [specialized] any of the cells that carry oxygen around the body; a red blood cell : hồng cầu

children.name: white blood cell
children.definition: / white corpuscle  a cell in the blood that has no red colour and is involved in the fight against infection : bạch huyết cầu; bạch cầu

children.name: corpuscle
children.definition: any of the red or white cells in the blood : huyết cầu

children.name: plasma
children.definition: / blood plasma the pale yellow liquid that forms 55% of human blood and contains the blood cells : huyết thanh

children.name: platelet
children.definition: a very small cell in the blood that makes it thicker and more solid in order to stop bleeding caused by an injury : tiểu cầu

children.name: blood
children.definition: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body : máu, huyết
examples: Her body was found in a pool of blood.
Blood oozed from a cut on his forehead.
Blood tests proved he was not the father.
lose blood(= from a cut or wound )He had lost a lot of blood and was very weak.
draw blood(= make someone bleed )He touched me with the knife and it drew blood.
blood flowsA quick walk will get the blood in your legs flowing again.
blood trickles(= moves slowly )The blood was beginning to trickle down his leg.
blood oozes(= comes out slowly )Blood was oozing from her forehead.
be covered in bloodHis face was covered in blood.
blood gushes/streams(= moves fast )A man was lying in the street with blood gushing from his head.
blood clots(= forms a mass and stops flowing )The blood should clot and stop the wound from bleeding.
be caked with blood(= covered with dry blood )The cat's fur was caked with blood.
be spattered/splattered with blood(= covered with small spots of blood )Today the only sign of violence is the walls spattered with blood.
a blood cellThe red blood cells carry oxygen.
a blood clot(= a mass formed when blood dries or sticks together )Blood clots in the legs are potentially fatal.
the blood flowFat reduces the blood flow to the surface of the skin.
the blood supply(= the blood that flows to a part of the body )the blood supply to the brain
a blood test(= a test done on your blood to see if you have a disease or another condition )
a blood sample(= a small amount of blood taken from your body to test )
a blood transfusion(= putting more blood in someone's body for medical reasons )
a drop of bloodPolice found tiny drops of blood in the apartment.
loss of bloodShe suffered a massive loss of blood.
a pool of bloodA dark pool of blood was spreading from his head.
a trickle of bloodA trickle of blood was coming from his nose.
-bloodedsuffixhaving the type of blood mentioned
warm-blooded

children.name: heart
children.definition: the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body :
examples: Regular exercise is good for the heart.
healthyEating oily fish can help maintain a healthy heart.
a bad/weak heart(= an unhealthy heart )The effort proved too much for her weak heart.
sb’s heart beats
Her heart was beating fast./ Can you hear my heart beating ?
sb’s heart pounds/thuds/thumps(= it beats very strongly )
He reached the top, his heart pounding.
sb’s heart races(it beats very fast )
Was there someone in the alley? Joe’s heart began to race.
heart trouble/problemsYou should not take this medication if you have heart problems.
heart diseaseSmoking increases the risk of heart disease.
a heart condition(= something wrong with your heart )The baby was born with a heart condition.
sb’s heart rate(= the number of times someone’s heart beats per minute )Your heart rate increases as you exercise.

children.name: circulation
children.definition: the movement of blood around the body : tuần hoàn máu
examples: Exercise improves the circulation.
good/bad circulation
Doctors had to remove her leg because of bad circulation.

children.name: blood donor
children.definition: sb who regularly gives some of their blood for ill people who need it: người cho máu, người hiến máu

children.name: give blood
children.definition: give/ donate blood to allow a trained person to take some blood from your body so that it can be stored and is ready to be given to people who have lost a lot of blood during an accident or operation
examples: the willingness of thousands of donors to give blood
The Health Service is asking for more people to donate blood.

children.name: vein
children.definition: a tube that carries blood to the heart from the other parts of the body: tĩnh mạch

children.name: blood vessel
children.definition: any of the tubes through which blood flows in the body : mạch máu; huyết mạch
examples: the blood vessels that lead to the heart

children.name: aorta
children.definition: the main artery (= thick tube carrying blood from the heart) which takes blood to the other parts of the body: động mạch chủ

children.name: artery
children.definition: one of the thick tubes that carry blood from the heart to other parts of the body: động mạch
examples: Hardening of the coronary arteries can lead to a heart attack.

children.name: capillary
children.definition: a very thin tube, especially one of the smaller tubes that carry blood around the body: mao mạch

children.name: vena cava
children.definition: one of the two very large veins through which blood returns to the heart, one from the upper body and head and one from all of the body below the chest : tĩnh mạch chủ
examples: Thesuperior(= upper) andinferior(= lower) venae cavae collect blood that has circulated around the body.

children.name: atrium
children.definition: / auricle  one of the two spaces at the top part of the heart which receive blood from the veins and push it down into the ventricles (= lower spaces) : tâm nhĩ

children.name: valve
children.definition: a device which opens and closes to control the flowof liquids or gases, or a similar structure in the heart and the veins, which controls the flow of blood: van
examples: heart valve[more specific]
It was a weakheartvalve that caused her death.

children.name: ventricle
children.definition: either of two small hollow spaces, one in each side of the heart, which force blood into the tubes leading from the heart to the other parts of the body: tâm thất

children.name: clot
children.definition: to form clots : cục nghẽn, đông lại
examples: He was rushed into hospital because his blood wasn't clotting properly.
an anti-(blood) clotting agent

children.name: bloodstream
children.definition: the flow of blood around the body : luồng máu
examples: The drug works more quickly if it is injected directly into the bloodstream.

children.name: positive
children.definition: having the rhesus factor in the blood : dương tính
examples: My blood type is O positive.

children.name: blood pressure
children.definition: a measure of the pressure at which the blood flows through the body : huyết áp
examples: The nurse willtakeyour blood pressure in a moment.
high/ low blood pressure
to have/suffer fromhigh/ lowblood pressure
High blood pressure increases the risk of a heart attack.

children.name: negative
children.definition: not having the rhesus factor in the blood: âm tính

children.name: blood type
children.definition: / blood group  one of the groups that human blood is divided into : nhóm máu
examples: What blood type are you?
arare/ commonblood type

children.name: ABO system
children.definition: / ABO blood group  the system that divides human blood into four main blood groups (= types of blood) , known as A, B, AB and O: hệ thống bốn nhóm máu A, B, AB và O

children.name: beat
children.definition: a regular movement or sound, especially that made by your heart : nhịp
examples: a heart rate of 80 beats a minute
heart beat
I put my head on his chest but I could feel noheartbeat.
My heart missed a beat (= I felt very excited) when she said, "Yes, I'll marry you".

children.name: pulse
children.definition: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body:mạchđập, nhịp tim
examples: His breathing was shallow and his pulse was weak .
weak/faintThe boy's pulse was very weak.
strongHe's breathing better. The pulse is stronger too.
rapid/fastSymptoms include a rapid pulse and dry skin.
slowHer pulse was slow but steady.
normalA normal pulse is between 70 and 90 beats a minute.
take sb’s pulse(= count the beats of their pulse )Remember to take your pulse at intervals while you are exercising.
check/feel sb’s pulseThe nurse left the room after checking the girl's pulse.
feel for a pulse(= try to find and check someone's pulse )I felt for a pulse, but I couldn't find one.
find a pulse(= be able to feel a pulse, which shows that someone is alive )To her relief, she found a pulse.
sb’s pulse beatsHis pulse began to beat with a fierce rhythm.
sb’s pulse races(= beats very quickly )His long fingers brushed hers, sending her pulse racing.
sb’s pulse quickens(= starts to beat faster )He heard a footfall in the passage outside and felt his pulse quicken.
pulse rate(= how fast your pulse beats )The doctor checked my weight and pulse rate.
pulse beatThe rhythm was steady, as regular as a pulse beat.

children.name: heartbeat
children.definition: the regular movement or sound that the heart makes as it sends blood around your body : nhịp đập của tim
examples: a steady heartbeat
